children.subject: CS70 homework difficulty will vary from person to person based on mathematical skill (sorta like cs work). Some finish psets in under an hour and others may take days. I'd say the average person (50th percentile) might take ~10 hours for an easier pset & upwards to 20 for a harder one?

I didn't take his 70 but:

If you're L&S:

Highly recommend taking his 70. His 70's grade averages are pretty high, which is important for the 3.3 GPA cutoff.

EECS:
depends. I took it with Vazirani.

Like one of the other commenters said, the workload strongly depends on your prior experience with proofs, probability, and discrete math. It doesn't make sense to poll people here, since the responses will be biased toward people who continued on in EECS. You'd be better off looking at the psets linked on the Fall 2014 homepage for CS 70 and estimating the workload for yourself.
Imo it was less heavy than EE 126 and CS 189, but the rest are definitely accurate.
It was definitely heavier than EE 126 and 189 when I took it (it was closer to about the same as EE 126's hw, but I was a better student by the time I took EE 126)

Yes, the workload strongly depends on prior experience. But I think it's rather telling that even with students like myself who went on to do well in CS, CS 70 with Sahai was a really really heavy workload. It was heavier than CS 170, EE 126, EE 127, CS 270, Math 104, Math 110, CS 189, etc.

So when I took 70, it was the first math class I had taken since AP Calc 5 years ago. That probably contributed to why it took me so long, but I don't think I was out of the norm. I had a crew of people that I went to every homework party of the week with (~9 hours), worked with after the homework parties (~3 hours) and who also routinely spent all of Sunday night writing up the homeworks/doing the programming problem/going through the stupid submission process. I don't think I submitted before 4 a.m. once. 

I unfortunately put so much energy into the class and had so much else on my plate that I think I was too sleep deprived to commit any of the class content to longterm memory. It's ironic because I'd imagine he gives the amount of work he does so that it sticks, but it had the opposite effect on me (got an A- though, so I'd imagine there were quite a few people worse on than me). So I guess the only positive thing I'd say about cs 70 with Sahai is that it wrecks you so hard that very few things seem daunting after it.

history.content: I'm considering taking CS 70 with Professor Sahai next semester, and am wondering what the homework load is like. I'm not averse to work, but I don't have a particularly light load next semester, so having this info is really important for helping me figure out my schedule. Note that the poll is completely anonymous :-)
history.subject: CS 70 w/ Prof. Sahai: How long did YOU spend on homework?
